case_vignette: A 5-year-old boy is brought in by his mother with reports of trouble at school. Teachers report that for the last 6 months he has been having difficulty finishing tasks, is easily distracted, frequently does not listen, commonly fails to finish schoolwork, has not been able to complete any of the class projects this year, and frequently loses school books and supplies. Teachers also say that he constantly fidgets, often leaves his seat without permission, has trouble being quiet, talks excessively, frequently interrupts his classmates when trying to answer questions, and has difficulty waiting in line. The mother states that she has also been noticing similar behaviors at home and that his symptoms have been affecting him negatively academically and socially. The patient has no significant past medical history. The patient is in the 90th percentile for height and weight and has been meeting all the developmental milestones. He is afebrile, and his vital signs are within normal limits. A physical examination is unremarkable.
question: Which  medications is a first-line treatment for this patient’s most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having trouble finishing tasks, getting easily distracted, and I don't listen when people talk to me a lot of the time.
How old are you?
I'm 5 years old.
Are you experiencing any difficulties in school, like following instructions or sitting still?
Yes, I have a hard time sitting still, I often leave my seat without permission, and I interrupt others a lot.
Have your parents or teachers expressed concerns about your behavior in comparison to other children your age?
My teachers say I can't seem to finish schoolwork or class projects, and I lose my school books and supplies. My mom has noticed that I behave similarly at home too.
Have you ever been diagnosed with any behavioral or developmental conditions in the past?
No, I haven't been diagnosed with any conditions like that before.
Have there been any changes at home or in school that might have affected your behavior?
Nothing's changed at home or school that I know of.
Has there been any history of attention disorders or similar symptoms in your family?
I'm not sure about my family's health history.
Is there anyone who can provide details about your family's health history? This information could be important.
My mom or dad would know about our family's health history.
Is it possible for your mom or dad to confirm if there's any family history of attention disorders or learning disabilities?
Yes, my mom or dad can confirm if there's any history like that in our family.
Please ask your mom or dad to confirm if any family members have been diagnosed with attention disorders or learning disabilities.

I've been having trouble finishing tasks, I get easily distracted, and I often don't listen when I'm supposed to.

Yes, I can't finish my schoolwork, I lose my books and supplies, I fidget a lot, I leave my seat, I talk too much, interrupt others, and I have trouble waiting my turn.
